with them for alms, went away to his estates. His new brethren gave him let- ters to the Kiev and Odessa Masons and prom- ised to write to him and guide him in his new activity. 
THE DUEL between Pierre and D61okhov was hushed up and, in spite of the Emperor's se- verity regarding duels at that time, neither the principals nor their seconds suffered for it. But the story of the duel, confirmed by Pierre's rupture with his wife, was the talk of society. Pierre who had been regarded with patron
